## Meeting Notes

### Artisan Brands International’s Automation Needs

- Starting to explore platforms to connect workflows and automate them with AI layer integration
- Currently using ADP Workforce for recruiting, trying to fill 10-12 positions simultaneously
- Want to send job descriptions/requisitions to LinkedIn, Indeed, other platforms
- Need AI filtering (ChatGPT/Claude) to screen resumes against qualifiers and non-negotiables
- Goal: Remove human component from first round screening, send only qualified candidates to hiring managers
- Currently lack HR director - need solution that incoming hire can continue using

### Current Pain Points & Process

- Courtney (Executive Assistant/current recruiter) manually opens every resume
- Most applications are unqualified/spam - time-intensive process
- \~300 resumes expected per job posting across all platforms
- Currently logs into ADP daily to check for new applications
- COO may receive email notifications but Courtney isn’t ADP administrator

### Expansion Plans Beyond HR

- Marketing automation opportunities
- Operations workflow improvements
- Additional HR processes
- Product development team integrations
- Need solution that’s easy for non-technical organization members to understand

### AutomateFlow Implementation Options & Pricing

- Self-serve plans: Teams ($249/month, 25 users, 20K tasks) vs Professional
- For 15 roles × 300 resumes = \~25K tasks monthly needed
- Enterprise plan: $65-70K annually with dedicated account management
  - Includes hands-on building support
  - Enhanced security/governance controls
  - Custom terms of service flexibility
- Expert partners available for one-off builds ($5-10K range)

### Technical Requirements & Challenges

- Main hurdle: ADP API connection (no native AutomateFlow integration)
- Need to work with ADP rep to establish API access
- 5-step automation process per resume review
- Parameters would be set by Courtney/Ramon/future HR director only
- Managers would only receive pre-qualified resumes

### Next Steps

1. Alex to send pricing details, security documentation, terms of service
2. Two-week free trial starting week of Feb 9th (after leadership on-site)
3. Follow-up meeting scheduled for Feb 24th to assess trial results
4. Ramon and Courtney to determine internal capability for building vs. needing support

tasks.prompt: Analyze the current state of this deal. Identify key risks, recommend next steps, and assess the likelihood of closing. Consider all available information.
Summarize this call. Identify key commitments made, objections raised, and action items. Assess the stakeholder sentiment.
Draft a follow-up email based on the recent interactions. The email should advance the deal, address any concerns raised, and include clear next steps.
Map the key stakeholders in this deal. For each, identify their role in the decision process, sentiment, concerns, and level of influence. Identify any missing stakeholders that should be engaged.
